column4: install ubuntu-main-menu, it comes with an applications browser and a preferences/administration browser.
where can i get some more info about this?
there is a DSL manager available, but it contains restricted code.
you can install the main-menu, purely for the app/settings browsers and not use the panel applet should you choose to.
any idea of why this does not come already installed with Ubuntu?
IMO, the menu bar set up is highly effective and perhaps the ubuntu devs feel it unnecessary.

nm-applet is a good, but very "instable" network manager(very complicated when setting up an wireless connection). i took a look at it's site and the current version(which comes wih Ubuntu) isn't that good thing. On the other hand, Sun's network monitor is...good =/
i have never had issues with network manager.
no crashes, no connection issues, nothing.
I use to travel a lot and when trying to get connected with public wireless network (hotels) it just does not work. it detects the network, but it just does not connect.
you need to select a network before it will connect. it is not in the habit of connecting to random unsecured wireless networks without user intervention.

I usually do that. click once on the icon from the notification area and type my password...but it seems it tries to connect but for some reason it not only does not work but also does not return me any error message
i agree Network Manager could use some more (ANY) effective error messages.
yeah. so...what about this drdsl? have you experienced some crash using it or it works just fine?
i use routers to connect to my DSL, so i don't have any experience with drdsl. i just knew of it's existance.
because running KDE apps in GNOME requires both gnome and KDE services to be running.
